name: nodeOCR
tagline: Implementation of nodecr for a node.js server
body:
### nodeOCR
A fast implementation of nodecr for a node.js server. Uses [node.js](http://nodejs.org), [tesseract-3.01](https://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/detail?name=tesseract-ocr-setup-3.01-1.exe), and [nodecr](https://github.com/joscha/nodecr).

### Installation
Install [node.js](http://nodejs.org), and [tesseract-3.01](https://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/detail?name=tesseract-ocr-setup-3.01-1.exe). Then, using shell, run:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/KevZho/nodeOCR.git
$ cd nodeOCR
$ install.bat
```

### Usage
```
$ run.bat
```

This sets up a web server at [http://localhost:8888](http://localhost:8888). You can then make POST requests with the request body as a base64 encoded jpeg file. The server will then return the OCR'ed text.

### Authors and Contributors
Without these projects, nodeOCR would not have existed:
* [node.js](http://nodejs.org)
* [tesseract](https://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr)
* [nodecr](https://github.com/joscha/nodecr)

nodeOCR is created by [Kevin Zhou](http://kevzho.github.io). It is released under the [MIT license](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).
